db module¶

class db.Db[source]¶

Bases: Backlog

A class representing a database interface for managing tickets.

Inherits from Backlog class.

A connection to the PostgreSQL database.

Type:

psycopg2.connection

cur¶

A cursor for executing database operations.

Type:

psycopg2.cursor

Retrieves all tickets from the database.

Returns:

Return type:

list

get_closed_tickets_between_days(min_days, max_days=None)[source]¶

Retrieves closed tickets from the closed backlog within a range of days.

Parameters:

  • min_days (int) – The minimum number of days since the ticket was closed.

  • max_days (int, optional) – The maximum number of days since the ticket was closed (default: None). If provided, only tickets closed within this range (inclusive of both ends) will be retrieved. If None, tickets closed at least min_days ago will be retrieved.

Returns:

A list containing closed tickets that meet the specified criteria.

Return type:

list

Note

If max_days is None, the function retrieves tickets closed at least min_days ago without an upper limit. Otherwise, it retrieves tickets closed within the range [min_days, max_days].

get_open_tickets_by_state_and_date(days, states=['analysis', 'assigned', 'solved', 'in_deliver'])[source]¶

Retrieves all tickets from the backlog older than a certain number of days.

Parameters:

  • days (int) – The number of days.

  • states (list) – The list of states to filter the tickets.

Returns:

A list containing all open tickets older than the specified number of days in a certain state.

Return type:

list
